titleStmt.title: Rapport lettre sure route de Tshela à Lukula par Maba
Report letter on the route from Tshela in Lukula by Maba

bibl.title: Report letter from Schmidt to Théophile Wahis

div1.p: No. 16 SUBJECT: Letter report on the Tshela route to Lukula by Maba

I am honored to bring to your attention that I have returned to Lakula by the Maba, Leange, Tuidi Zambi and Punze chiefdoms. I took this journey, following the declarations of Chief Thomas Lutete during his visit to Tshela.
In his chiefdom, he would have recieved Mr. American Consul, accompanied by the Vungu Missionary acting as an interpreter.
The latter asked throughout his travels, in what way they manage their territory and moreover, how many times the chiefs whipped the natives when they did not pay their tax.
The Agents of the Colonies equally posed relative questions to the recruitment workers.
I pointed out to Thomas Lutete the gravity of his declarations and he told me to keep them.

He has furthermore, as well as the decorated chief Paoli de Moduda, the intention for this motive; to return to Boma next. He complains equally of the name Thomas Dedé, cathéchiste of the Kinkenzi mission, who authorizes a lot of abuses in his chiefdom and to recognize his authority of being a decorated chief.

A lot of indigineous subchiefs having complained about it he askes me if you could not send him a magistrate, in order for all men to see reason for once. There is a question of the chief's arrest for the settling of accounts then a judgment arrived in a palaber by the name of Thomas Dede, etc. etc.
commissioner of the district of Bas-Congo
